title: Drawing, "A Shipwreck", 1800–25
medium: Pen and ink, brush and sepia wash over black chalk on laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Two masters obliquely shown on top of wave which looks like jaws of hell.  Sail blown off. Woman flying upon cloud, extends hand towards stern of ship.  Buildings of city shown at left in distance. Framing lines.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "A Shipwreck", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and ink, brush and sepia wash over black chalk on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2861.
